SnippetsTable.Name: Circuit Diagram
Mindmap
SnippetsTable.Description: Example copied from the Tikz manual

SnippetsTable.Name: Green arrow
NOPREVIEW
SnippetsTable.Description:
Prevent TikzEdt from inserting \PreviewEnvironment command.
Insert at head of document.

SnippetsTable.Name: STANDALONE
SnippetsTable.Description:
Tell TikzEdt that this document is standalone if not detected automatically. Document is compiled as is. This option is useful if the \begin{document} command is included via an input file.
Insert at head of document.

SnippetsTable.Name: Invisible
SnippetsTable.Description: Node for creating anchors for edges.

SnippetsTable.Name: Document
SnippetsTable.Description: Node in shape of document (with little corner)

SnippetsTable.Name: Message
SnippetsTable.Description: Node with shape of a UML note

SnippetsTable.Name: sloped
SnippetsTable.Description: Add text label to edge. Insert directly after "edge" and before name or coordinate of destination of edge.

SnippetsTable.Name: edge node
SnippetsTable.Description: Add text label to edge. Insert directly after "edge" and before name or coordinate of destination of edge.

SnippetsTable.Name: Node within Node
SnippetsTable.Description: Nested node example

SnippetsTable.Name: Compiler options
SnippetsTable.Description: The command %!TEO <bla> adds the pdflatex compiler option <bla>.

SnippetsTable.Name: (Un)Comment
SnippetsTable.Description: The string "%!TE%" is removed by TikzEdt prior to compilation. Use this (for example) to include further input files.

SnippetsTable.Name: TE Input
SnippetsTable.Description: Use this to include files only in TikzEdt. The standard use-case is that you input multiple tikzpictures in some master tex-file and you want to use a common set of commands or styles.

SnippetsTable.Name: Parser Ignore
SnippetsTable.Description: Use %/* ... %*/ to hide some lines of code from the Parser in case it reports an error in an otherwise correctly compiling tikz file.
SnippetsTable.SnippetCode: %/* This line is ignored by the TE parser. %*/

SnippetsTable.Name: Button
SnippetsTable.Description: From the pgf manual.
SnippetsTable.SnippetCode: \tikzset{button/.style={ % First preaction: Fuzzy shadow preaction={fill=black,path fading=circle with fuzzy edge 20 percent, opacity=.5,transform canvas={xshift=1mm,yshift=-1mm}}, % Second preaction: Background pattern preaction={pattern=#1, path fading=circle with fuzzy edge 15 percent}, % Third preaction: Make background shiny preaction={top color=white, bottom color=black!50, shading angle=45, path fading=circle with fuzzy edge 15 percent, opacity=0.2}, % Fourth preaction: Make edge especially shiny preaction={path fading=fuzzy ring 15 percent, top color=black!5, bottom color=black!80, shading angle=45}, inner sep=2ex }, button/.default=horizontal lines light blue, circle}
SnippetsTable.SampleCode: \usetikzlibrary{shadows, patterns} \tikzset{button/.style={ % First preaction: Fuzzy shadow preaction={fill=black,path fading=circle with fuzzy edge 20 percent, opacity=.5,transform canvas={xshift=1mm,yshift=-1mm}}, % Second preaction: Background pattern preaction={pattern=#1, path fading=circle with fuzzy edge 15 percent}, % Third preaction: Make background shiny preaction={top color=white, bottom color=black!50, shading angle=45, path fading=circle with fuzzy edge 15 percent, opacity=0.2}, % Fourth preaction: Make edge especially shiny preaction={path fading=fuzzy ring 15 percent, top color=black!5, bottom color=black!80, shading angle=45}, inner sep=2ex }, button/.default=horizontal lines light blue, circle} \begin{tikzpicture} \node [button] at (0,0) { Big}; \end{tikzpicture}
